regex.description:
Whether to consider the code, old and new attributes as regular expressions or not. \
                                 Note that the regular expressions are parsed as Java regular expressions, not \
                                 Javascript ones.

code.description: The code of the difference to ignore. This attribute is mandatory.

old.description:
The human readable representation of the old element that must match in order to \
                                 ignore the element. The human readable representation of the elements is defined \
                                 by the extensions, so you need to consult the documentation of the respective \
                                 extension to find out the expected format. This attribute is optional. If not \
                                 specified the old element is not taken into account.

new.description:
The human readable representation of the new element that must match in order to \
                                 ignore the element. The human readable representation of the elements is defined \
                                 by the extensions, so you need to consult the documentation of the respective \
                                 extension to find out the expected format. This attribute is optional. If not \
                                 specified the old element is not taken into account.

justification.description: The justification for ignoring the difference.
